meanings.definition: Reduce or extinguish a debt by regular payments.
meanings.sent1: I will amort my loan by making monthly payments.
meanings.sent2: She amort her mortgage over a period of twenty years.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to amort its nut collection by sharing with friends.
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to amort the sadness in her heart, bit by bit.
meanings.sent5: The sun's rays slowly amort the darkness of the night.

meanings.definition: Gradually write off the initial cost of an asset.
meanings.sent1: The company plans to amort the new equipment over five years.
meanings.sent2: He amort the computer purchase to spread out the expense.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to amort the toy mouse by playing with it gently.
meanings.sent4: The artist's talent seemed to amort the blank canvas with colors.
meanings.sent5: The wind's gentle touch seemed to amort the heat of the day.
